message_1: A factor analysis study was conducted on a set of 20 variables. After extracting the factors, it was found that the first two factors explain 60% and 25% of the total variance, respectively. What is the total percentage of variance explained by these two factors combined?
message_2:
To find the total percentage of variance explained by these two factors combined, simply add the percentages of each factor:

60% (Factor 1) + 25% (Factor 2) = 85%

So, the first two factors combined explain 85% of the total variance.
